definition: audition/to give sb an audition/to check by listening
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: I have send a carton - The Polar Express.
sentences.chinese: 这里有北极特快车完整版的电影配乐试听。

sentences.english: There's a 10-minute time limit for students on trial at Hiknow. com.
sentences.chinese: 试听的乐知学员有10分钟的时间限制。

sentences.english: the recordings are available for listening at the library in London.
sentences.chinese: 录音资料可在伦敦的图书馆中试听。

sentences.english: And she's actually been sending me auditions  for the last couple of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 她是在两周前给我发来的试听邀请。

sentences.english: The horn is OK appreciably ground is twisted upcountry, should inspect try audition effect actually to decide.
sentences.chinese: 喇叭可以略微地向内扭，要视实际试听的效果来决定。

sentences.english: When I auditioned and got invited to join, it marked a big change in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我前去试听并获邀加盟，这标志了我的人生大转折。

sentences.english: I auditioned and they asked me what kind of music I was composing for the OVA.
sentences.chinese: 我做了试听，他们问我将为OVA配上什么样的音乐。

sentences.english: None of the actresses we've auditioned is suitable.
sentences.chinese: 我们试听的这些女演员都不合适。

sentences.english: Tomorrow I’m auditioning for the school play, and I need every bit of help I can get.
sentences.chinese: 明天我要参加学校的试听表演，我需要获得一点帮助。

definition: to read a sample chapter of a book/to subscribe to a publication on a trial basis/to attend classes on a trial basis
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
